greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(sum of distinct prime factors of n, product of distinct prime factors of n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
mathematica: PrimeFactors[n_Integer] := Flatten[ Table[ # [[1]], {1}] & /@ FactorInteger[n]]; f[n_] := Block[{pf = PrimeFactors[n]}, GCD[Plus @@ pf, Times @@ pf]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 93}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 04 2004 *)
xref: Differs from related A099635 for the first time at n=84, where a(84) = 6, while A099635(84) = 12.
Differs from A014963 for the first time at n=30, where a(30) = 10, while A014963(30) = 1.
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Oct 28 2004
